revised_title: Exploring the Possibility of Multiple Memory Systems in the Mammalian Brain
tldr: The article discusses the idea of multiple memory systems in the mammalian brain, suggesting that different types of memory, such as short-term memory, knowledge and skills, stable associative memory, event memory, and priming, may have distinct mechanisms and anatomical dispositions. The author reviews neuropsychological and neurological evidence to support the possibility of independent memory systems that still interact with each other, similar to how perceptual systems function.
